original_solution_mapping.L1: He has 2 contracts that are 132 pages each so that's 2*132 = <<2*132=264>>264 pages
original_solution_mapping.L2: He can only shred 6 pages at a time so it will take him 264/6 = <<264/6=44>>44 units

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 3489.
    Returns: the number of times Enrique will shred paper.
    """
    # L1
    num_contracts = 2 # 2 contracts
    pages_per_contract = 132 # 132 pages each
    total_pages = num_contracts * pages_per_contract

    # L2
    shredder_capacity = 6 # shred 6 pages at a time
    shredding_times = total_pages / shredder_capacity

    # FA
    answer = shredding_times
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: He has {num_contracts} contracts that are {pages_per_contract} pages each so that's {num_contracts}*{pages_per_contract} = <<{num_contracts}*{pages_per_contract}={total_pages}>>{total_pages} pages
He can only shred {shredder_capacity} pages at a time so it will take him {total_pages}/{shredder_capacity} = <<{total_pages}/{shredder_capacity}={shredding_times}>>{shredding_times} units

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: He has 2 contracts that are 132 pages each so that's 2*132 = <<2*132=264>>264 pages
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: He can only shred 6 pages at a time so it will take him 6/6 = <<6/6=1>>1 units

explanation: Incorrect operand. The variable 'shredder_capacity' (value: 6) was used instead of 'total_pages' (value: 264).
